resources.string:
Home screen

Various widgets are displayed on the start screen, which can be selected in the settings.

Data records can be searched across modules using the magnifying glass.

The refresh button updates all visible widgets.

The menu takes you to the settings and to the export / import.

Export/Import

Here it is possible to export data from the app in different formats or to import data into the app.

One can export to a PDF file, a text file, a CSV file or an XML file
and import data from a text file, a CSV file or an XML file.

You can export or import data from all modules. It is possible to select all data sets or only certain ones.

Settings

You can get to the settings screen by touching "Settings" in the menu on the start screen.

Here you can choose between 4 main categories:

  1. General (general settings)
  2. Start screen (settings for the wigets on the start screen)
  3. Thematic settings (settings for the modules)
  4. Export / import (settings for the interfaces)

Note lists

In this module it is possible to create point grade lists, which you need as a grade list for class work.

There are different types of lists: linear, with kinks, exponential and IHK.

Dictation mode:
There is no number of points in dictation mode which must be achieved, but a number of errors, which can be achieved for a maximum of one grade.

Linear note list:
The linear grade list is the simplest list. You can specify a maximum number of points, indicate whether there are tenth or quarter grades and you can set whether there are whole or half points.

List of notes with curtsey:
Here you can also specify a number of points until when there is the best or worst grade. And an additional note and the associated points.

Exponential Note-list:
Setting the same as for the linear note list.

IHK grade list:
Setting the same as for the linear note list.

 

Menu:
In the menu you can find a list of notes with their settings set as default or save grade lists. You also get to the expanded graphical view here.

Extended graphical view:
The list of grades is shown graphically here. The switches can be used to adjust the settings and in the menu you can export the settings.

Calculate grades

Here you can by giving results in class tests and tests calculate the current grade point average.

By pressing the buttons in the footer area, years or subjects can be added.

If you have selected a year or a subject in the header area A round button appears in the footer area. If you press on it you can create a new class test or test. you can weight them differently by specifying the weighting.

Timetable

Here you can enter new timetables for a year.

By pressing the buttons in the foot area you can compartments, Add classes, teachers, years and times.

If you give known abbreviations to the subjects of the app, these are added automatically.

If you indicate the beginning of the hour at the times the end is automatically switched to the beginning by 45 minutes.

If you press one of the blue boxes in the timetable entry, a dialog opens, in which you can specify the subject, the teacher and a room number.

Notes

Here you can enter notes.

If you press the microphone, you can dictate it to the app.

If title says, the following part is entered as title, if you say description, the following part is entered as description.

ToDo-Lists

Here you can add to-do lists.

If you press the button in the footer area, you can enter new ToDo lists.

If you select a list in the header area, you can add new todos by pressing the plus.

Here you can set different priorities.

School-Timer

Here you can add new events.

You can search for a date in the upper part or use the arrows to change the day.

By pressing the plus you can add an event.

Learning-Cards

Here you can create index cards and be queried.

In the foot area you can use the buttons for subjects, teachers, Create groups or index cards and queries.
